handDesc.p: Script characteristic of the early Majapahit period.

projectDesc.p: The project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_v01.xml file.

revisionDesc.change: started initial encoding of the inscription

div.p:
Irikā divaśanyājñā
śrī mahārāja, śrī yava-bhuvana-parameśvara, Aninditānubhāva-paraākrama kalpa-druma-paārijāta-nā
ma-samānādhikaraṇa, kṣatra-vaṅśa-kula-vyapagata-ghaṇa-gagaṇa-tārā-gaṇa-saṁkīrṇa-pūrṇa-śaśāṅka-nirbhi
nna, saṅgrāma-śūra-śūratara-śūra, jagat-kāla-kūṭāri-rāja-dhvaṅsa-kāra, sāśaśāsanāntaka-nara-vara-śiraccheda
kāraṇa, vivarṇṇa-pariśūnya-samasta-ripu-hetuka, sakala-sujana-hr̥daya-kamala-vika-sat-sūryya-sa
dr̥śa, yava-bhuvaneaikaāgra-citta-nipunṇa-prārthi-sthity-ekātapatra, rakryān· mantrī saṅgrāmavija§
ya śrī kr̥tarājasa jayavārddhana nāmarājābhiṣeka, sacaturbhrātr̥patnīka, sacchāya ta sira lā
van sira śrī rantən· hajinira catusaānak·, samasta-kr̥tanagara-duhitā, paḍa ta sira putrī d
e bhaṭāra śrī kr̥tanagara, sira saṁ līna ri śivabuddhālaya, makaādi śrī parameśvarī, dyaḥ
devī tribhuvaneśvarī, śrī mahādevī, dyaḥ devī narendraduhitā, śrī jayendrade
2
vī, dyaḥ devī prājñāparāpāramitā, śrī rājendradevī, dyaḥ devī gaāyatriī, kumārarājasa
tputraparigata,

Iniriṁ ta sira denira rānakira saṁkvke śrī parameśvarī, sira ta prabhu sukumā
rasulaksaṇa, śrī kr̥tanagara-satpotra-kumārarāja, jaya śrī viṣṇuvārddhana sat-prapotra-ku§
mārarāja, Udita-nava-sahasra-kiraṇopamānāninditānubhāva-paraākrama daha-nagara-pratiṣṭṣṭhi
ta śrī jayanagara nāma rājābhiṣeka kumārarāja,

tinaḍaḥ de rakryān· mahāmantrī katrīṇi
rakryān· mantrī hino, dyaḥ pamasi, yauddhāti-śūra-rāja-darśana-hetu-śūra, rakryān· mantri si
rikan·, dyaḥ palisir·, yuddhāti-dhīradakṣa-rāja-darśana-hetu-dakṣa, rakryān· mantrī halu, dyaḥ siṅlar·,
yuddhāti-dhiīra-rāja-darśana-hetu-dhīra,

Umiṅsor i para taṇḍa rakryān· riṁ pakira-kiran makabeha
n·, rakryān apatiḥ, pu tāmbi, kr̥ṣṇa-rāja-pāṇy-uddhata-bhramanṇa-su-cakra-sadr̥śa-raṇāti-śūra, ra§
kryān apatiḥ riṁ daha, pu sora, ravi-kīiraṇāvāaraṇa-jalada-visarjjana-pracaṇḍānila-samāna-ra
ṇāti-śūra, rakryān· dmuṁ, pu renteṁ, tvarita-pravāha-mahā-nadī-samaāna-raṇāti-śūra, rakryā
n· dmuṅ iṁ daha, pu rakat·, mahā-krūra-siṅha-varābheda-raṇāti-śūra, rakryān· kanuruhan·,
3
pu Elām·, pramatta-gajendra-nirbhinna-raṇāti-śūra, rakryān· kanuruhan iṁ daha, pu Ivar·, ga§
dă-dhara-bhīma-tulya-raṇāti-śūra, rakryān· raṅga, pu śaśiī, vividha-sśalabha-gharṣita-pradiīpo
pamāna-raṇāti-śūra, rakryān· raṅga riṁ daha, pu diīpo, Anekormi-yoga-mahopalānūna-
raṇāti-śūra, rakryān tuməṅguṁ, pu vāhana, vr̥kṣāgra-su-gandha-kusuma-darśaka-bhramara-sannibha-
raṇāti-śūra, rakryān tuməṅguṅ iṁ daha, pu pamor·, śusṣkendhana-vana-prajvalitāa-dalābha-raṇā
ti-śūra, makapramuka saṁ mantrī vāgmīmaya mapasəṅgahan·, saṁ nayapati, pu luṅgaḥ, para-naya
nyāyănyāya-vodhādhi-nayănaya-guṇa, saṁ prāṇarāja, pu sina, rājaraja-raja-kāryya-kriyā
śrănta, saṁ satyaguṇa, pu baṅo, para-hita-da-jñāna-hpara-dūtātmakāneka-guṇa-sampanna, mvaṁ saṁ mantrī
keśadhariī, mapusṣpapāta ḍaṅ ācāryyāgraja, mapañji nirătmaka, bhajorddhvatā-sarvvopāya-kuśa
la-samasta-dharmma-saṁrakṣaṇa-devatā-viśeṣānusmaraṇa-tatpara-sādhana-paripālana, rakryān· juru
kr̥tarājasajayavarddhana, mapuṣpapāta ḍaṅ ācāryyāstrarāja, rājorddhvatā-sarvva-nīti-dakṣo
padeśa-nipunṇa-samasta-jana-karuṇika-sādhana-paripālana, tan kavuntat· saṁ prāgvivăka vyavahăra
4
-nyāyānyāya-vicchedaka, saṁ pamgət i tirvan·, ḍaṁ ācāryya kusumăyudharipu, mapañji păragata
dvinayana, săṁkya-vyākāaraṇa-parisamāpta, saṁ pamgət i maṅhuri, ḍaṅ ācāryyāṅgarakṣa, săṁkya-śā
stra-parisamāpta, saṁ pamgət i jamba, ḍaṅ ācāryya rudra, dvinayana, nyāya-vyākāaraṇa-parisamā
pta, saṁ pamgət i pamvatan·, ḍaṅ ācāryya rāgavijaya, dvinayana nyāya-vyākāaraṇa-parisamāpta,
saṁ pamgət i pamvatan iṁ daha, ḍaṅ ācāryya manmatha, nyāya-śāstra-parisamāpta, saṁ pamgət i tigāṁ rat, ḍaṅ ā
cāryya mahānātha, nyāya-śāstra-paripālana,

I piṅsorny ājñā śrī mahārāja, kumonakənn iri
kāṁ vanva riṁ sukhāmr̥ta, thāni vatək· paṅkaḥ, Ataganiṁ vahuta jana-tyə̄san·, padamlakna saṁ hyaṅ ā
jñā haji praśāsti, tinaṇḍa kr̥tarājasajayavārddhanalañcaṇa, makarasa ri rehanikāṁ sukāmr̥
ta, An mantuka sīma, sīmāni saṅ apañji patipati, pu kapat·, katmva kalilirakna deni santāna prati
santāna saṅ apañji patipati, mne hləm· tka ri dlāhaniṁ dlāha,

sambandha, gati saṅ apañji patipati An tu
mut saduḥkhamanastapa śrī mahārāja, ṅuni ri līna bhaṭāra śrī kr̥tanagara, kari ta sira vālaputra
makakamantryan· saṅgrāmavijaya, hana pva saṅ apañji patipati, sākṣāt vuruk de bhaṭāra śrī
5
kr̥tanagara, satata saṅkan· rarai tan saḥ ri pāda-piīṭhanira, mapariṇāmāṅgintiri, makāvaśsānma dmuṁ, ri lī
na bhaṭāra śrī kr̥tanagara pva, samaṅkana ta saṅ apañji patipati, Ann umiriṁ salaku śrī mahārāja, lumiṁsi
ri durjana, mamet jīvasaṁrakṣaṇa, mvaṁ ryy āavaśsānanirān kari vālaputra de bhaṭāra śrī kr̥tanagara, va
nāntara-praveśa-giri-śikhara-laṅghaniya-sarit-samudra-prataraṇānālaṣsa, tan suṁkan ta sirerika kab
baiḥ, duḥkkhoṣadha-parimārggaṇa-hetu, makanimitta kapetani tambaniṁ duḥkkha, tan kantun ta saṅ apañji pa
tipati, mvaṁ lumakvani sapaṅutuś śrī mahārāja, mahāvarṣā-chātri-kāndhakārolka-hasta, Udan apayuṁ,
ptəṅ asuluḥ saṅ apañji patipati An umulahākən· kāryya śrī mahārāja, śrī mahārāja pva sira kṣatriya
devăṅśa, su-lakṣaṇa-nara-rūpa-svarggāvatĭrṇa, Āpan sira devatā viśeṣa tumurun sakeṁ svargga makarūpa
rājaputra sulakṣaṇa, paṅatibyaktana, dhīra-satya-śānta-su-śīla-kuśala-jana-priya-raṇāti-śūra-bala
-koṭy-asaṁkula-kanakādi-dhana-sampanna-svabhāvaṁ, makasvabhāva ta sirerika kabaiḥ ya tika paṅliṅgan i
sirān devamūrtti, Athavā, mahānr̥paty-anugraha-svasty-ayana, ndān makātmarakṣa ta sira varānugra
ha bhaṭāra śrī kr̥tanagara, Ikāṁ saṅgrāmavijayasaṁjñā, ya tikenāṁkənnākən· msaniruktyān niya
6
tanirān jayaśatru riṁ saṅgrāma de bhaṭāra śrī kr̥tanagara, Āpan tan dadi mitthyānugrahaniṁ kadi sira pra
bhu mahāviśeṣa, yavāyava-dvīpa-rājāanya-maheśvara, Āpan sira ṅuni ratuniṁ ratu riṁ yavabhuvana tu
mulyani ratuniṁ nūṣāntara, ri tadanāantara, dumon ta sira mara ri deśanikāṁ duṣṭadurjana ri bhaṭāra śrī
kr̥tanagara, tan kantun ta saṅ apañji patipati, tka pva sirerika, mtu teki kadevātmakanira, kavus ṅəs-ṅə
sən· tekāṁ śatru tan pasara, Ekalomnmānipāta, tan· rumurvakən· vulu salambā gatinya kevala pa
ravaśa, hantu vadvanya, katavan· ratunya, hinir ānak·rabinya, Inalap rājadr̥vyanya, siśīrṇna-bhasmī
bhūta-niravaśeṣa, tlas· hilaṁ pvaṁ śatru denira, kaṅsa-rājāntaka-vāla-kr̥ṣṇa-nirbhinna, tan pabheda ta sira (2) lāvan saṁ kr̥ṣṇān vālaputra, Umilaṅakən saṁ prabhu kaṅsa, riṁ kapva rājaputravāla jaya riṁ raṇa, siddhasā- (3) dhya pva sira, rājābhiṣekanyăsita-rājābhāraṇa-maṇḍita-ratna-kanaka-siṅhāsanā-rūpa, riṁ samaṅkana ta sira- (4) n paṅadəg· prabhu, Anyaśaktinirăśraya, tan pamarăśraya ta sira ri śaktiniṅ anya, svaśaktyăśraya, ke- (5) vala makasahāya śaktinira, svayaṁ*prabhūdeśasamārtha, sira tekĭnajarākən svayaṁ*prabhu deniṁ sakalal- (6) oka, ca muvaḥ, durjanaduḥkitasamastajana-sāgara-mandārācala-manthāna-mahāmr̥ta-maya, sākṣā-

app.note: P proposes correction to śa. But Damais (1955: 80–1) has shown that ca is correct.
These elements are identical to the corresponding elements in Sarvadharma.
P proposes correction to vr̥śchika, but mr̥cchika is actually better attested in the corpus than the more standard spelling vr̥śchika.
This epithet is paralleled in Adan-adan, lines 2r4-2v1.
Poerbatjaraka proposes to correct rājorddhvatā, in view of the parallel structure of the compound lines 4r5-6: rājorddhvatā-sarvva-nīti-dakṣopadeśa-nipunṇa-samasta-jana-karuṇika-sādhana-paripālana.
See several other instances of the term paripālana in the Sanskrit epithets in this section (l. 4r4, 4v6).
The scribe may have taken a punctuation sign for an anusvāra.
Or else emend Ekalomnonipāta, and understand Ekalomno ’nipāta?

div.p: First edited by F.H. van Naerssen, with translation into Dutch (46-57III). Re-edited here by Arlo Griffiths based on autopsy and photos of the plate.
